text: Malcolm Scott Ciencin (September 1, 1962 - August 5, 2014) was an American writer of adult and children's' fiction. He wrote over ninety books in his career. He was a New York Times bestselling author. He co-authored many books with his wife Denise Ciencin. He also wrote comic books, screenplays and video games. He was connected with Dungeons & Dragons and Dinotopia. Ciencin died from a brain blood clot on August 5, 2014 in Sarasota, Florida. He was 52. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1962 births Category:2014 deaths Category:American children's writers Category:American comics writers Category:American novelists Category:American screenwriters Category:Deaths from blood clot Category:Deaths from heart failure
title: Scott Ciencin
